intro: Bassovia lucida, commonly known as the shining bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, often with a yellow or orange throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Bassovia lucida is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
